columns.name: user_name
columns.description: The friendly name of the user.

columns.name: user_arn
columns.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the user.

columns.name: user_creation_time
columns.description: The date and time when the user was created.

columns.name: generated_time
columns.description: The date and time when the credential report was created, in ISO 8601 date-time format (http://www.iso.org/iso/iso8601).

columns.name: access_key_1_active
columns.description: Does the user have an access key and is the access key's status Active.

columns.name: access_key_1_last_rotated
columns.description: The date and time when the user's access key was created or last changed.

columns.name: access_key_1_last_used_date
columns.description: The date and time when the user's access key was most recently used to sign an AWS API request. When an access key is used more than once in a 15-minute span, only the first use is recorded in this field.

columns.name: access_key_1_last_used_region
columns.description: The AWS Region in which the access key was most recently used. When an access key is used more than once in a 15-minute span, only the first use is recorded in this field.

columns.name: access_key_1_last_used_service
columns.description: The AWS service that was most recently accessed with the access key. The value in this field uses the service's namespace—for example, s3 for Amazon S3 and ec2 for Amazon EC2. When an access key is used more than once in a 15-minute span, only the first use is recorded in this field.

columns.name: access_key_2_active
columns.description: Does the user have a second access key and is the access key's status Active.

columns.name: access_key_2_last_rotated
columns.description: The date and time when the user's second access key was created or last changed.

columns.name: access_key_2_last_used_date
columns.description: The date and time when the user's second access key was most recently used to sign an AWS API request. When an access key is used more than once in a 15-minute span, only the first use is recorded in this field.

columns.name: access_key_2_last_used_region
columns.description: The AWS Region in which the user's second access key was most recently used. When an access key is used more than once in a 15-minute span, only the first use is recorded in this field.

columns.name: access_key_2_last_used_service
columns.description: The AWS service that was most recently accessed with the user's second access key. The value in this field uses the service's namespace—for example, s3 for Amazon S3 and ec2 for Amazon EC2. When an access key is used more than once in a 15-minute span, only the first use is recorded in this field.

columns.name: cert_1_active
columns.description: Does the user have an X.509 signing certificate and is that certificate's status Active.

columns.name: cert_1_last_rotated
columns.description: The date and time when the user's signing certificate was created or last changed.

columns.name: cert_2_active
columns.description: Does the user have a second X.509 signing certificate and is that certificate's status Active.

columns.name: cert_2_last_rotated
columns.description: The date and time when the user's second signing certificate was created or last changed.

columns.name: mfa_active
columns.description: Whether a multi-factor authentication (MFA) device has been enabled for the user.

columns.name: password_enabled
columns.description: When the user has a password, this value is true. Otherwise it is false. The value for the AWS account root user is always false.

columns.name: password_last_changed
columns.description: The date and time when the user's password was last set.

columns.name: password_last_used
columns.description: The date and time when the AWS account root user or IAM user's password was last used to sign in to an AWS website.

columns.name: password_status
columns.description: The status of an user password. Password status can be one of used, never_used and not_set.

columns.name: password_next_rotation
columns.description: When the account has a password policy that requires password rotation, this field contains the date and time.
